intro: Sabicea mollis, commonly known as the silky sabicea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain seeds. Sabicea mollis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
